extendedInfo.description: Born from the idiom: "Birds of a feather flock together," Feathr aims to help you grow your flock of professional contacts by helping you automate your follow-up workflow. When you meet someone, you can connect, follow, email, and save them to your contacts â removing the need for business cards and the hassle for follow-up later. Feathr also lets you keep track of the people you meet, and reminds you when you don't follow up with them.

reviews.title: (Insert title here)
reviews.comment: I don\'t know, they just followed me on Twitter so I figured why not give them a shot? To sum everything up... I don\'t see myself deleting this app anytime soon.
reviews.author: Jordon McLeod

reviews.title: Can\'t see capcha
reviews.comment: If LinkedIn chooses to display a capcha, it isn\'t completely visible on HTC Magic.  An old phone, but still.  On a later attempt no capcha was presented, so was finally able to authenticate.
reviews.author: Jason Boxman

reviews.title: Good Start, but more to be done.
reviews.comment: Good start guys, but some suggestions:  Is there a way to notify me if there are feathr users nearby? That would be a great way to remind me to use it instead of exchanging business cards.   Also it would be cool if it worked similar to bump, so I could exchange cards without having to search for the other person.
reviews.author: Tony Dieppa

reviews.title: Awesome,
reviews.comment: Needs to use NFC to transmit my businesses contact info and email my daily specials through the WiFi when ever a customer walks by or is inside my cafe. And direct them to my business site when ever they use our WiFi as well. now I can prove that business cards are a thing of the past.
reviews.author: CHEF Lucas
